resources.string: COVID-19 is an infectious respiratory disease caused by a newly discovered coronavirus. The first case of the virus was detected in Wuhan, China on 31st December, 2019. Since then, the virus has travelled to several countries while being declared as a pandemic. The coronavirus spreads through contact with an infected person when they cough or sneeze. It also spreads when a person touches their eyes, nose or mouth after touching a surface or object that has the virus on it.

The best way to prevent the infection from spreading is to wash your hands with soap and water or an alcohol-based hand sanitizer. Other ways of preventing oneself from getting the virus include: 
 • Maintaining a distance of at least 1 meter 
 • Covering your mouth and nose while coughing/sneezing 
 • Avoid touching your face, 
 • Maintain social distancing.

Most people affected by COVID-19 are likely to have mild to moderate symptoms that may not require special treatment. People at high risks are mostly the ones who have underlying medical conditions or those above 60 years. 
 Common symptoms of the virus include: 
 • Fever 
 • Dry Cough 
 • Fatigue 
 In case if the situation escalates, the patients are likely to experience the following: 
 • Shortness of breath • Body ache • Sore throat 
 A few people might experience diarrhoea, nausea or a runny nose.

ï‚· Stay at home and avoid unnecessary contact. 
 • In case of fever, cough and shortness of breath seek immediate medical help. 
 • Take all sorts of preventive measures to stop the spread of coronavirus. 
 • Remain updated on the latest developments about COVID-19 as made available on the WHO website and app.
